arm_group.description: Children between 6 to 24 months received ready-to-used supplementary food every months during the whole year.
children between 6 to 24 months of one zone received  a ready-to-used supplement food during the 4 months of the hunger gap period (june to september)

brief_summary.textblock:
The hypothesis for the study is that 12 months of a Ready-To-Use Supplementary Food (RUSF)
      distributions have a greater impact on children's health than the standard RUSF
      distributions during the hunger gap period (june to september). We estimated that the 12
      month RUSF will decrease the incidence of severe acute malnutrition by 33% compared to an
      administration only during the hunger gap period (4 month a year).

clinical_study.brief_title: Non Randomized Controlled Intervention Study Comparing Two Interventions of Nutritional Supplement on Malnutrition, Health and Mortality

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  children between 6 months and 24 months of age

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  children who can 't swallow

          -  children from parents who does not want to be in the study

clinical_study.official_title: Non Randomized Controlled Intervention Study Comparing Two Interventions of Nutritional Supplement on Malnutrition, Health and Mortality in Children Aged 6 to 24 Month Hadjer-Lamis Region - Chad

authority: Chad: Nutrition & Agriculture Technologies National Committee

primary_outcome.description:
Incidence of acute severe malnutrition will be assessed for the overall 2 years.
Estimation if incidence will include children from their entry in the study to their exit of study (disharge as 24 months, dead of Lost of follow up )
Mortality will be assessed for the overall 2 years. Estimation will include children from their entry in the study to their exit of study (disharge as 24 months, dead of Lost of follow up )

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention
